LayoutNode.Content: 6/30/2018 It can get super hyphy in here! I love how there are differentdance rooms, playing different music. The only reason why I gave3 stars and not 4 or 5 is because, during private events- theyclose down one of the rooms, making the others crammed andpacked. I went on a Saturday, and there was a private partyhappening, so everyone was jammed into 2 rooms and there wasonly 1 bar open. $10 cover, and it was too crowded too dance andgetting a drink was impossible. My suggestion: hide mini shots in your bra.

LayoutNode.Content: Came on Saturday for my birthday weekend celebration. Westayed at Parc55 and went here through a friend'srecommendation. Diana, the bartender there, was great. Nice andsuper accommodating. It's a smaller venue and doesn't have muchof a dance floor near the bar, but everyone there made it workand had a blast. The music selection was great. A good mixture ofnew and old school hip hop and pop. There's another open areaas you walk in, but it's not as crackin' as the bar area. Irecommend dancing near the center island so you can hang yourcoat/purse underneath where there are hooks. For the most part,people are respectful and just there to have fun. Friendlier crowdthan LA. My boyfriend and I had such an amazing time and met some greatpeople. Besides the stinky dude rubbing all up on him, the crowdwas pretty cool and diverse. We acted silly and danced all the waytill closing. Great drinks, great company. We will be back!
LayoutNode.SRC: Came on Saturday for my birthday weekend celebration. Westayed at Parc55 and went here through a friend'srecommendation. Diana, the bartender there, was great. Nice andsuper accommodating. It's a smaller venue and doesn't have muchof a dance floor near the bar, but everyone there made it workand had a blast. The music selection was great. A good mixture ofnew and old school hip hop and pop. There's another open areaas you walk in, but it's not as crackin' as the bar area. Irecommend dancing near the center island so you can hang yourcoat/purse underneath where there are hooks. For the most part,people are respectful and just there to have fun. Friendlier crowdthan LA.My boyfriend and I had such an amazing time and met some greatpeople. Besides the stinky dude rubbing all up on him, the crowdwas pretty cool and diverse. We acted silly and danced all the waytill closing. Great drinks, great company. We will be back!

LayoutNode.Content: 10/13/2018 Hell of a good time for a random Friday night. Good old schoolvibes dance hip hop and oldies top 40s hits are spinning and thekids are hollaring and stamping. Its crowded and everything abt itis dirty fun. Bartenders are quick and drinks strong. What else canyou ask for when you just want to DANCE DANCE DANCE!!

10/13/2018

Hell of a good time for a random Friday night. Good old school vibes dance hip hop and oldies top 40s hits are spinning and the kids are hollaring and stamping. Its crowded and everything abt it is dirty fun. Bartenders are quick and drinks strong. What else can you ask for when you just want to DANCE DANCE DANCE!!

LayoutNode.Content: BEST BIRTHDAY EVER!!!! Honestly I picked this spot due to the fact that it's a bar/lounge witha live dj and close to home. Trying to figure out a spot to celebratethe big 3-1 was a headache because half of my friends are biglounging drinkers and the other half, wild drinkers who love toshake what their mama or daddy gave them. I was contactedpromptly by Chris after emailing the business about booking atable for my event. It was definitely nice to have someone get backto me quickly and efficiently. We went over prices, details and theevent was booked!! *A large booth for the night of Sat, January27* Upon arriving for the event (no waiting in line as promised by Chrisbecause we're vip!!) my girls and I were greeted by Chris, ledthrough the front door, right pass security, into the main floor andright to our large booth. The large booth area consists of onelarge comfy couch right next to the dj booth, a bottle of our choice(they have a wide selection, just ask your host), unlimitedjuice/soda (up to 3 choices) and glassware. Music was on point all night (it was a range of new and old schoolr&b and hip hop), the dj was amazing and knew what he was doingto hype up the crowds. The bartenders don't skimp on the alcohol.(So if you're a 1, 2, 3, floor type of drinker I suggest you makesure to tell the bartender exactly how you like your drink). Thestaff and security took very well care of us in making sure we wereenjoying our night. I do have to say I LOVED that there was adiversity amongst the crowds; from your freshly young 21yrs oldsto uncles/aunties getting down on the dance floor, from yourwallflowers to your wild drinkers. Bruno's atmosphere shows youexactly what's like to be a Frisco native. It was a beautiful feeling tosee everyone having a time of their lives and having the courtesyto apologize if they accidently step on your pedicured toes Overall it was an amazing night and the BEST BIRTHDAY EVER!!!Thank you to Chris, the staff and security for having us!! Wedefinitely will be back!! *I would recommend reserving a table if you're more of a loungingdrinker or have a big crowd with you for the night as it tends to getbusy as the night comes to an end. *Please sign up on the guest list for any event; free before 11pm *5+ stars if I could but yelp only allows 5

LayoutNode.Content: Yelp 100 Challenge 2017 - 96/100 For my friends' birthday, we decided to check out Bruno's after ourpregame for some Saturday night fun. The bouncer charged us$10/person for cover and said price would only increasethroughout the night. I don't recall the name of the DJ but s/heplayed a variety of 90's hiphop as well as some more recent top40's. It was a blast! My boyfriend bought me a Moscow Mule and it's so delicious!Even though the bartender literally filled vodka to more than halfof my glass, the Moscow Mule still tasted really good! I think it's theginger soda she used. Overall, I definitely want to visit Bruno's again next time I'm in SF.There were friendly peeps on the dancefloor, solid bartenders,and all around great vibes throughout the night. Oh, and I witnessan intense fight between 4 bouncers and a very angry dudeoutside while waiting for the uber. CRAY.
LayoutNode.SRC: Yelp 100 Challenge 2017 - 96/100For my friends' birthday, we decided to check out Bruno's after ourpregame for some Saturday night fun. The bouncer charged us$10/person for cover and said price would only increasethroughout the night. I don't recall the name of the DJ but s/heplayed a variety of 90's hiphop as well as some more recent top40's. It was a blast!My boyfriend bought me a Moscow Mule and it's so delicious!Even though the bartender literally filled vodka to more than halfof my glass, the Moscow Mule still tasted really good! I think it's theginger soda she used.Overall, I definitely want to visit Bruno's again next time I'm in SF.There were friendly peeps on the dancefloor, solid bartenders,and all around great vibes throughout the night. Oh, and I witnessan intense fight between 4 bouncers and a very angry dudeoutside while waiting for the uber. CRAY.

LayoutNode.Content: From what I remember during my visit last Friday night, this placecharged a cover of $5- whether you were male of female. I thoughtthis was lame, but moving on... By the time we got in, the place was packed with people thatlooked half my age. This made me want to drink more, tears-lol.Anyway, the non-VIP area is pretty small. My group and I found aslice of a corner near the VIP tables and made it our own VIP area.After seeing the VIP tables not in use a couple of my gf's decidedto sit down but then eventually got kicked out of the tables bysecurity. It was weird because the time was quickly approachingafter midnight yet the VIP tables weren't in use, so they shouldhave just opened it to make it general seating. As the night went on, the crowd stayed the same...sausagefest,wayyyy more horny guys then classy ladies. We left there shortlyafter 1am, and to top off my night, we had Mission Hot Dogs rightoutside Bruno's. All in all, Bruno's is a small lounge bar thatdoesn't have that much dancing space, but houses a hot dog cartin front of its establishment after 1am.

LayoutNode.Content: Randomly came here on a Saturday night with the hubby duringdate night. We headed to the bar to get drinks and suddenlyfound a piece of some nasty ass gum which someone stuck on thetable he leaned against. Pretty much spent the first few minutesgetting this off his new Polo sweater that he wore for the first time.Anyway, we didn't let that stop our fun. We saw a huge group walkover to the other side and we were wondering why. So that's whenwe realized that there was another dancefloor and a bar whichonly played hip hop so at that point, we pretty much danced therest of the night away. We drank, sweated my ass off, twerked alittle then went on our merry way home. 'Twas a good night!
LayoutNode.SRC: Randomly came here on a Saturday night with the hubby during date night. We headed to the bar to get drinks and suddenly found a piece of some nasty ass gum which someone stuck on the table he leaned against. Pretty much spent the first few minutes getting this off his new Polo sweater that he wore for the first time. Anyway, we didn't let that stop our fun. We saw a huge group walk over to the other side and we were wondering why. So that's when we realized that there was another dancefloor and a bar which only played hip hop so at that point, we pretty much danced the rest of the night away. We drank, sweated my ass off, twerked a little then went on our merry way home. 'Twas a good night!

LayoutNode.Content: 8/29/2018 My iPhone X was stolen at this bar last weekend. The next day, myfriends wallet was stolen at this bar. Think it's safe to say this is noplace to bring valuable items and I will not be going back. Iunderstand this can happen anywhere but I've heard this fromseveral people about this place maybe they should up theirsecurity.
LayoutNode.SRC:
8/29/2018

My iPhone X was stolen at this bar last weekend. The next day, my friends wallet was stolen at this bar. Think it's safe to say this is no place to bring valuable items and I will not be going back. I understand this can happen anywhere but I've heard this from several people about this place maybe they should up their security.

LayoutNode.Content: 8/19/2018 The worst bar in San Francisco. I don't normally write reviews butthis was by far the worst experience I've had. I will never comeback. Went on a Saturday with a group of friends, and seemed likean okay bar. We got drinks and then I walked upstairs into anotherroom, which unbeknownst to me was a private party. A bouncercame up to me and told me he was going to kick my expletiveexpletive if I didn't leave. I tried explaining I didn't know what hewas talking about and that it was open to walk upstairs. Instead hegrabbed me by the shoulders and pushed me downstairs. Iapologized and raised my hands to surrender. He and his fellowbouncers followed me out on to the street and pushed me awayfrom the bar even though we were on the sidewalk
LayoutNode.SRC:
8/19/2018

The worst bar in San Francisco. I don't normally write reviews but this was by far the worst experience I've had. I will never come back. Went on a Saturday with a group of friends, and seemed like an okay bar. We got drinks and then I walked upstairs into another room, which unbeknownst to me was a private party. A bouncer came up to me and told me he was going to kick my expletive expletive if I didn't leave. I tried explaining I didn't know what he was talking about and that it was open to walk upstairs. Instead he grabbed me by the shoulders and pushed me downstairs. I apologized and raised my hands to surrender. He and his fellow bouncers followed me out on to the street and pushed me away from the bar even though we were on the sidewalk

LayoutNode.Content: Fun, fun and fun! Dress up, dress down but come to have fun. Whatever happened to bars like this? Drinks are not expensiveand the bar isn't too difficult to order from. The dj played a mashup of hip hop, rap, r&b, and house. The crowd never stopeddancing and everyone was pretty courteous....besides the randomdrunk girl and guy that smelled like B.O. and danced...way to closeto us. Haha oh well, it happens. This place has that trendy urbanbar located it that random spot that you'd never realize existed. Our bartender was Diana.....always a pleasure to see her. In asea of people see is able to identify people fast, get their order,get it out and at the same time recognizes the next person so theydon't feel they are getting passed over. She's personable, looksgreat and really takes care of her customers. I used to managenight clubs and bars and she is mastered the art of the serviceindustry. Make EVERYONE feel VIP. That's tough but she does itand that's what brongs people back. The dance floor was anywhere you were standing and that's ok. The vibe was chill and the music was jammin. The crowd was agreat mix of all ethnicities and ages but all were mature and thereto have a great time with no trouble. I look forward to heading back and partying the night away in a booth with friends dancing, laughing and celebrating like it's 1999.

LayoutNode.Content: 4/9/2018 Hands down, this is my favorite place for going out in SanFrancisco! Drinks are reasonably priced, bar lines are not crazy,and the music is always so good! The DJs play a good mix of hiphop, R&B, bay area music and top 40--it's a win-win for all. Andunlike many places in the city, people actually dance here!
LayoutNode.SRC:
4/9/2018

Hands down, this is my favorite place for going out in San Francisco! Drinks are reasonably priced, bar lines are not crazy, and the music is always so good! The DJs play a good mix of hip hop, R&B, bay area music and top 40--it's a win-win for all. And unlike many places in the city, people actually dance here!
1 person voted for this review

LayoutNode.Content: 5/20/2018 It was okay. It will be super packed... Just be aware of that. Myfriends and I had a good time. It would have been nice to have alittle more variety in the music, but the other guests in the placedidn't seem to mind.
LayoutNode.SRC:

LayoutNode.Content: Came here one night for a friends birthday party. There was nocover which was nice and pretty empty when we got there (around10:30pm) but slowly picked up by 11:30. The DJ played a lot of old school hip hop and R&B which wasrefreshing since there aren't too many places that do anymore. The crowd was very diverse and the drinks weren't too pricey(especially for SF). It is the mission so the surrounding area is kind of sketchy at nightbut just use caution and you'll be fine. You can rent out the entire floor for special events, at least thatwhat I heard the DJ say when he did the bday shout outs. The bottom floor which was were we hung out all night wasinteresting. It looks like a lower deck on a ship. One of the bartenders was pretty rude as well...

LayoutNode.Content: I like Bruno's! Cool vibe, cool people, cool location, and cool harddrinks. Smack dab in the heart of the mission district with a niceaura about it. Not a club and not a dive bar, but just a very solidneighborhood nightclub that has people coming from near and farto hang out and have a great time. Bruno's has four rooms with each room spinning different tunes toadhere to everyone's taste. Food is available as well from CaesarSalads to Short ribs. Crowd ranges from early twenties to midthirties. With that said crowd is diverse, has a touch ofsophistication and class, hint of hipster tech with a splash ofrugged neighborhood Frisco. "I love that mix!". Ample space todance and enjoy yourself with a few friends or a massive group.Usually a $10 dollar cover charge which is not bad at all in myopinion considering the quality of drinks. If your ever in SanFrancisco I would definitely recommend hitting up Bruno's if youdon't feel like getting all spruced up in nightclub attire. P. S. - Bruno's is considered a SF historical landmark and hasbeen around for 60+ years @ 20th & Mission.

Food is available as well from CaesarSalads to Short ribs. Crowd ranges from early twenties to midthirties. With that said crowd is diverse, has a touch ofsophistication and class, hint of hipster tech with a splash ofrugged neighborhood Frisco. "I love that mix!". Ample space todance and enjoy yourself with a few friends or a massive group.Usually a $10 dollar cover charge which is not bad at all in myopinion considering the quality of drinks. If your ever in SanFrancisco I would definitely recommend hitting up Bruno's if youdon't feel like getting all spruced up in nightclub attire.P. S. - Bruno's is considered a SF historical landmark and hasbeen around for 60+ years @ 20th & Mission.

LayoutNode.Content: 3/11/2018 The alcohol selection was not great. They have a decent amountof beers but none on tap. The bartender refused to make a mojitosaying it was too girly. The staff was on the rude side for the mostpart. The only good thing was the dj was great and played someawesome hip hop throwbacks.
LayoutNode.SRC:
3/11/2018

The alcohol selection was not great. They have a decent amount of beers but none on tap. The bartender refused to make a mojito saying it was too girly. The staff was on the rude side for the most part. The only good thing was the dj was great and played some awesome hip hop throwbacks.

LayoutNode.Content: 8/21/2016 I really enjoyed the music here last night. We came around 10PMand it was just slowly starting to pickup. There was a wide rangeof tunes everything from tswift to rap music from the 90's. It gotpretty packed, by the time we were leaving there was a line to getin and I was breaking a sweat. Unfortunately the upper level was closed so I couldn't comment onthat. We also didn't try any food since we had dinner at lolinda,however it's a solid spot if you want to dance the night away.
